documentation.text:
@notice Get Arbitrum block number (distinct from L1 block number; Arbitrum genesis block has block number 0)
 @return block number as int

@notice Get Arbitrum block hash (reverts unless currentBlockNum-256 <= arbBlockNum < currentBlockNum)
 @return block hash

@notice Gets the rollup's unique chain identifier
 @return Chain identifier as int

@notice Get internal version number identifying an ArbOS build
 @return version number as int

@notice Returns 0 since Nitro has no concept of storage gas
 @return uint 0

@notice check if the caller (of this caller of this) is an aliased L1 contract address
 @return true iff the caller's address is an alias for an L1 contract address

@notice return the address of the caller (of this caller of this), without applying L1 contract address aliasing
 @return address of the caller's caller, without applying L1 contract address aliasing

@notice creates a send txn from L2 to L1
 @param position = (level << 192) + leaf = (0 << 192) + leaf = leaf
@dev DEPRECATED in favour of the new L2ToL1Tx event above after the nitro upgrade

L2ToL1Transaction(address,address,uint25.details: DEPRECATED in favour of the new L2ToL1Tx event above after the nitro upgrade

params.reserved: an index meant only to align the 4th index with L2ToL1Transaction's 4th event

isTopLevelCall().details: this call has been deprecated and may be removed in a future release

returns._0: true if current execution frame is not a call by another L2 contract
address of the caller's caller, without applying L1 contract address aliasing

returns.partials: hashes of partial subtrees in the send history tree
returns.root: root hash of the send history
returns.size: number of sends in the history

sendTxToL1(address,bytes).details: it is not possible to execute on the L1 any L2-to-L1 transaction which contains data to a contract address without any code (as enforced by the Bridge contract).

returns._0: a unique identifier for this L2-to-L1 transaction.
true iff the caller's address is an alias for an L1 contract address
unique identifier for this L2-to-L1 transaction.

L2ToL1Tx(address,address,uint256,uint256.notice: creates a send txn from L2 to L1

SendMerkleUpdate(uint256,bytes32,uint256.notice: logs a merkle branch for proof synthesis

arbBlockHash(uint256).notice: Get Arbitrum block hash (reverts unless currentBlockNum-256 <= arbBlockNum < currentBlockNum)

arbBlockNumber().notice: Get Arbitrum block number (distinct from L1 block number; Arbitrum genesis block has block number 0)

arbChainID().notice: Gets the rollup's unique chain identifier

arbOSVersion().notice: Get internal version number identifying an ArbOS build

getStorageGasAvailable().notice: Returns 0 since Nitro has no concept of storage gas

isTopLevelCall().notice: (deprecated) check if current call is top level (meaning it was triggered by an EoA or a L1 contract)

mapL1SenderContractAddressToL2Alias(addr.notice: map L1 sender contract address to its L2 alias

myCallersAddressWithoutAliasing().notice: return the address of the caller (of this caller of this), without applying L1 contract address aliasing

wasMyCallersAddressAliased().notice: check if the caller (of this caller of this) is an aliased L1 contract address

withdrawEth(address).notice: Send given amount of Eth to dest from sender. This is a convenience function, which is equivalent to calling sendTxToL1 with empty data.

userdoc.notice: For use by contracts to interact with core L2-specific functionality. Precompiled contract that exists in every Arbitrum chain at address(100), 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000064.
